articles.headline: A Baby Step Toward Rules on Bank Risk
articles.snippet: Banks lobbying against strict standards would like us to forget that it was undercapitalized financial institutions that got us into this mess.
articles.abstract: Banks lobbying against strict standards would like us to forget that it was undercapitalized financial institutions that got us into this mess.
articles.lead_paragraph: Two years later, the banks hope we have forgotten.

articles.headline: Hedge Fund Managers Set Up for Next Acts
articles.snippet: Hedge fund managers who closed their firms are opening new funds, and in some cases promising to make previous investors whole before taking performance fees.
articles.abstract: Hedge fund managers who closed their firms are opening new funds, and in some cases promising to make previous investors whole before taking performance fees.
articles.lead_paragraph: James J. Pallotta, a legend of the hedge fund industry, is calling a do-over.

articles.headline: Roma, on Move, Test Europe’s ‘Open Borders’
articles.snippet: Thousands of Romania’s Roma, also known as Gypsies, are heading for the relative wealth of Western Europe, causing political tensions.
articles.abstract: Thousands of Romania’s Roma, also known as Gypsies, are heading for the relative wealth of Western Europe, causing political tensions.
articles.lead_paragraph: BUCHAREST, Romania  This city is full of stark, Soviet-era housing blocks, and the grimmest among them  gray towers of one-room apartments with communal bathrooms and no hot water  are given over to the Roma population.

articles.headline: F.D.A. Panel Urges Denial of Diet Drug
articles.snippet: By a 9-to-5 vote, the advisers decided that the potential benefits of the drug lorcaserin, from Arena Pharmaceuticals, did not outweigh risks.
articles.abstract: By a 9-to-5 vote, the advisers decided that the potential benefits of the drug lorcaserin, from Arena Pharmaceuticals, did not outweigh risks.
articles.lead_paragraph: A federal advisory panel on Thursday recommended against approval of a new diet pill, the latest setback in efforts to develop treatments for the nation’s obesity epidemic.

articles.headline: At 103, a Judge Has One Caveat: No Lengthy Trials
articles.snippet: Judge Wesley E. Brown uses an oxygen tube in his Kansas courtroom but has no plans to stop working.
articles.abstract: Judge Wesley E. Brown uses an oxygen tube in his Kansas courtroom but has no plans to stop working.
articles.lead_paragraph: WICHITA, Kan.  Judge Wesley E. Brown’s mere presence in his courtroom is seen as something of a daily miracle. His diminished frame is nearly lost behind the bench. A tube under his nose feeds him oxygen during hearings. And he warns lawyers preparing for lengthy court battles that he may not live to see the cases to completion, adding the old saying, “At this age, I’m not even buying green bananas.”

articles.headline: Once Wary, Obama Now Relies on Petraeus
articles.snippet: Progress in Afghanistan will define the relationship between the president and his top commander.
articles.abstract: Progress in Afghanistan will define the relationship between the president and his top commander.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When President Obama descended into the White House Situation Room on Monday for his monthly update on Afghanistan and Pakistan, the new top American military commander, Gen. David H. Petraeus, ticked off signs of progress.
articles.byline: By HELENE COOPER, DAVID E. SANGER and THOM SHANKER

articles.headline: Chief of Unit With Recalls to Exit J.&J.
articles.snippet: The company said Colleen Goggins, 56, who has been overseeing one of the company’s three major divisions, would retire in March.
articles.abstract: The company said Colleen Goggins, 56, who has been overseeing one of the company’s three major divisions, would retire in March.
articles.lead_paragraph: A longtime senior executive at Johnson & Johnson in charge of the consumer products division is leaving the company early next year, signaling a shake-up after a troubling series of recalls, including of children’s Tylenol, tarnished the company’s reputation in the last year.
articles.byline: By Natasha Singer and Reed Abelson

articles.headline: S.E.C. Seeks to Reinstate a Debt Rule
articles.snippet: The commission was unanimous on a proposal to curb the practice of temporarily trimming company debt at quarter’s end to dress up financial statements.
articles.abstract: The commission was unanimous on a proposal to curb the practice of temporarily trimming company debt at quarter’s end to dress up financial statements.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Securities and Exchange Commission unanimously approved on Friday a proposal to reinstate a requirement that publicly traded companies disclose more information about their short-term borrowings.
